name: AsanaDuplicateProject
description:
Initiate duplication of a project in Asana.

Creates and returns a job to handle the asynchronous duplication of a project in Asana. It requires 'projects:write' scope.

parameters.name: project_global_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the project to be duplicated.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the project.

parameters.name: include_optional_fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of optional properties to include in the response, such as additional project details.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: new_project_name
parameters.description: The name for the duplicated project in Asana.

value_schema.description: The name of the new project.

parameters.name: new_project_team_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the team to set for the new project. If not provided, the project will remain in the same team as the original.

value_schema.description: Sets the team of the new project. If team is not defined, the new project will be in the same team as the the original project.

parameters.name: include_elements_in_project_duplication
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of optional elements to include when duplicating a project. Some elements are auto-included and cannot be excluded.

value_schema.description:
A comma-separated list of elements to include when duplicating a project.
Some elements are automatically included and cannot be excluded,
while others are **optional** and must be explicitly specified in this field.

**Auto-included fields (non-configurable)**
- Tasks
- [Project Views](https://asana.com/features/project-management/project-views)
(i.e., tabs in a project such as List, Board, Dashboard, etc.)
- [Rules](https://help.asana.com/s/article/rules)

*Note: The Owner of the Rules copied to the new project is the user who performs the API call.
If the duplication is performed using a [Service Account](/docs/authentication#/service-account),
note that Service Accounts cannot access the UI to modify or pause Rules.
To prevent unwanted automation behavior, consider pausing Rules in the source project before duplication —
their active/paused state is preserved in the new project.*

**Optional fields (configurable)**
- allocations
- forms
- members
- notes
- permissions
- task_assignee
- task_attachments
- task_dates
- task_dependencies
- task_followers
- task_notes
- task_projects
- task_subtasks
- task_tags
- task_templates
- task_type_default

parameters.name: last_due_date_in_duplicated_project
parameters.description: Sets the last due date in the duplicated project. The subsequent due dates will be offset similarly to the original project.

value_schema.description: Sets the last due date in the duplicated project to the given date. The rest of the due dates will be offset by the same amount as the due dates in the original project.

parameters.name: start_date_for_first_task
parameters.description: Sets the first start date in the duplicated project. Adjusts other start dates based on this.

value_schema.description: Sets the first start date in the duplicated project to the given date. The rest of the start dates will be offset by the same amount as the start dates in the original project.

parameters.name: pretty_output_enabled
parameters.description: Enable pretty formatting for the response output. Useful for debugging but increases response size and time.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: skip_weekends_in_schedule
parameters.description: Set to true to skip weekends for auto-shifted dates in the duplicated project schedule. This is a required parameter.

value_schema.description: **Required**: Determines if the auto-shifted dates should skip weekends.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: opt_pretty
parameters.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: opt_fields
parameters.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: project_gid
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the project.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the project.

parameters.name: data.name
parameters.description: The name of the new project.

value_schema.description: The name of the new project.

parameters.name: data.team
parameters.description: Sets the team of the new project. If team is not defined, the new project will be in the same team as the the original project.

value_schema.description: Sets the team of the new project. If team is not defined, the new project will be in the same team as the the original project.

parameters.name: data.include
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of elements to include when duplicating a project.
Some elements are automatically included and cannot be excluded,
while others are **optional** and must be explicitly specified in this field.

**Auto-included fields (non-configurable)**
- Tasks
- [Project Views](https://asana.com/features/project-management/project-views)
(i.e., tabs in a project such as List, Board, Dashboard, etc.)
- [Rules](https://help.asana.com/s/article/rules)

*Note: The Owner of the Rules copied to the new project is the user who performs the API call.
If the duplication is performed using a [Service Account](/docs/authentication#/service-account),
note that Service Accounts cannot access the UI to modify or pause Rules.
To prevent unwanted automation behavior, consider pausing Rules in the source project before duplication —
their active/paused state is preserved in the new project.*

**Optional fields (configurable)**
- allocations
- forms
- members
- notes
- permissions
- task_assignee
- task_attachments
- task_dates
- task_dependencies
- task_followers
- task_notes
- task_projects
- task_subtasks
- task_tags
- task_templates
- task_type_default

To prevent unwanted automation behavior, consider pausing Rules in the source project before duplication —

parameters.name: data.schedule_dates.should_skip_weekends
parameters.description: **Required**: Determines if the auto-shifted dates should skip weekends.

value_schema.description: **Required**: Determines if the auto-shifted dates should skip weekends.

parameters.name: data.schedule_dates.due_on
parameters.description: Sets the last due date in the duplicated project to the given date. The rest of the due dates will be offset by the same amount as the due dates in the original project.

value_schema.description: Sets the last due date in the duplicated project to the given date. The rest of the due dates will be offset by the same amount as the due dates in the original project.

parameters.name: data.schedule_dates.start_on
parameters.description: Sets the first start date in the duplicated project to the given date. The rest of the start dates will be offset by the same amount as the start dates in the original project.

value_schema.description: Sets the first start date in the duplicated project to the given date. The rest of the start dates will be offset by the same amount as the start dates in the original project.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
